abstract: Michael Eisner has settled into a comfortable post-Disney existence, staking a claim on Web entertainment.
snippet: Michael Eisner has settled into a comfortable post-Disney existence, staking a claim on Web entertainment.
lead_paragraph: ON a Friday morning in September, Michael D. Eisner was in a television studio on the East Side of Manhattan, asking Robert L. Nardelli, the chairman of Chrysler, whether he nursed a grudge against Jack Welch for passing him over for the top job at General Electric eight years ago.

headline.main: After Disney, Eisner Finds a Home Online
headline.print_headline: Far From Disney’s Fold, but at Home on the Web
